p: The leaves of M. peguensis were gathered from Dhaka, Bangladesh and were ascertained by the experts of Bangladesh National Herbarium, Mirpur, Dhaka and a voucher specimen (DACB; Accession no: 62166) has been deposited for this collection. After cutting the leaves into pieces, they were dried in room temperature without the exposure of direct sunlight and then crushed with the help of a high-powered grinding machine. The final product sample was 0.7 kg M. peguensis coarse powder.
